verses.kjv: Thou therefore, my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
verses.ct: So, my son, draw your strength from the grace that comes through Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: And the things that thou hast heard of me among many witnesses, the same commit thou to faithful men, who shall be able to teach others also.
verses.ct: Take the things you've heard me teach in front of many witnesses and pass them on to trustworthy people who will be able to teach others as well.

verses.kjv: Thou therefore endure hardness, as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: Share in suffering like a dedicated soldier of Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: No man that warreth entangleth himself with the affairs of this life; that he may please him who hath chosen him to be a soldier.
verses.ct: A soldier on active duty doesn't get caught up in civilian matters — his goal is to please the one who enlisted him.

verses.kjv: And if a man also strive for masteries, yet is he not crowned, except he strive lawfully.
verses.ct: Similarly, an athlete doesn't receive the winner's crown unless they compete according to the rules.

verses.kjv: The husbandman that laboureth must be first partaker of the fruits.
verses.ct: The farmer who puts in the hard work should be the first to enjoy the harvest.

verses.kjv: Consider what I say; and the Lord give thee understanding in all things.
verses.ct: Think carefully about what I'm saying, and the Lord will give you insight into all of it.

verses.kjv: Remember that Jesus Christ of the seed of David was raised from the dead according to my gospel:
verses.ct: Remember Jesus Christ, a descendant of David, who was raised from the dead — this is the core of my gospel.

verses.kjv: Wherein I suffer trouble, as an evil doer, even unto bonds; but the word of God is not bound.
verses.ct: Because of this gospel, I'm suffering hardship, even chained up like a criminal. But the word of God is not chained.

verses.kjv: Therefore I endure all things for the elect’s sakes, that they may also obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.
verses.ct: That's why I endure everything for the sake of God's chosen people, so that they too can receive the salvation found in Christ Jesus, along with eternal glory.

verses.kjv: It is a faithful saying: For if we be dead with him, we shall also live with him:
verses.ct: Here is a trustworthy statement: If we have died with him, we will also live with him.

verses.kjv: If we suffer, we shall also reign with him: if we deny him, he also will deny us:
verses.ct: If we endure, we will also rule with him. If we disown him, he will also disown us.

verses.kjv: If we believe not, yet he abideth faithful: he cannot deny himself.
verses.ct: If we are unfaithful, he remains faithful — because he cannot contradict his own nature.

verses.kjv: Of these things put them in remembrance, charging them before the Lord that they strive not about words to no profit, but to the subverting of the hearers.
verses.ct: Keep reminding people of these things. Warn them before the Lord not to argue over words — it accomplishes nothing and only ruins those who listen.

verses.kjv: Study to shew thyself approved unto God, a workman that needeth not to be ashamed, rightly dividing the word of truth.
verses.ct: Do your best to present yourself to God as someone approved, a worker who has no reason to be ashamed, correctly handling the word of truth.

verses.kjv: But shun profane and vain babblings: for they will increase unto more ungodliness.
verses.ct: Stay away from godless, empty talk, because it leads people deeper and deeper into ungodliness.

verses.kjv: And their word will eat as doth a canker: of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;
verses.ct: Their teaching will spread like gangrene. Hymenaeus and Philetus are examples of this.

verses.kjv: Who concerning the truth have erred, saying that the resurrection is past already; and overthrow the faith of some.
verses.ct: They have wandered away from the truth by claiming that the resurrection has already happened, and they are destroying the faith of some people.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless the foundation of God standeth sure, having this seal, The Lord knoweth them that are his. And, Let every one that nameth the name of Christ depart from iniquity.
verses.ct: Even so, God's solid foundation stands firm, marked with this inscription: 'The Lord knows those who belong to him,' and 'Everyone who claims the name of Christ must turn away from wickedness.'

verses.kjv: But in a great house there are not only vessels of gold and of silver, but also of wood and of earth; and some to honour, and some to dishonour.
verses.ct: In a large house, there aren't just containers made of gold and silver — there are also ones made of wood and clay. Some are used for honorable purposes, and some for common ones.

verses.kjv: If a man therefore purge himself from these, he shall be a vessel unto honour, sanctified, and meet for the master’s use, and prepared unto every good work.
verses.ct: So if anyone cleanses themselves from dishonorable things, they will be a container for honorable use — set apart, useful to the master, and ready for every good work.

verses.kjv: Flee also youthful lusts: but follow righteousness, faith, charity, peace, with them that call on the Lord out of a pure heart.
verses.ct: Run away from the desires of youth. Instead, pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace, alongside those who call on the Lord with a pure heart.

verses.kjv: But foolish and unlearned questions avoid, knowing that they do gender strifes.
verses.ct: Refuse to get involved in foolish and ignorant debates, because you know they only produce conflicts.

verses.kjv: And the servant of the Lord must not strive; but be gentle unto all men, apt to teach, patient,
verses.ct: The Lord's servant must not be quarrelsome but instead be kind to everyone, able to teach, and patient.

verses.kjv: In meekness instructing those that oppose themselves; if God peradventure will give them repentance to the acknowledging of the truth;
verses.ct: They should gently correct those who oppose them, in the hope that God may perhaps grant those people repentance, leading them to recognize the truth.

verses.kjv: And that they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil, who are taken captive by him at his will.
verses.ct: Then they can come to their senses and escape the trap of the devil, who has captured them to do his bidding.
